content: What is the SQL statement to insert multiple records into a table?

To insert multiple records into a table using a single SQL statement, you can use the `INSERT INTO` statement with multiple sets of values enclosed in parentheses and separated by commas. Here is the general syntax:

```sql
INSERT INTO table_name (column1, column2, column3, ...)
VALUES 
    (value1a, value2a, value3a, ...),
    (value1b, value2b, value3b, ...),
    (value1c, value2c, value3c, ...),
    ...;
```

Here's an example with a table named `employees` that has columns `id`, `name`, and `position`:

```sql
INSERT INTO employees (id, name, position)
VALUES 
    (1, 'Alice', 'Manager'),
    (2, 'Bob', 'Developer'),
    (3, 'Charlie', 'Designer');
```

This SQL statement will insert three records into the `employees` table. Each set of values corresponds to one record.
